Package SecurityLightController

Class LightTimer

java.lang.Object
SecurityLightController.LightTimer
All Implemented Interfaces:
LightTimerInterface
public class LightTimer extends Object implements LightTimerInterface
This class implements a light timer. It is used to control the timeouts associated with a given light.

  • Field Details

    • myDelay

      private int myDelay
      This variable holds the delay in milliseconds until the timer expires.

    • remainingTime

      private int remainingTime

    • callback

      private final LightControllerCommandInterface callback
      This variable holds the callback which is invoked when the timer expires.

    • eventToFire

      private LightControllerCommandInterface.CommandActionEnum eventToFire
      This is the event that is to be fired when the timer expires.

    • periodic

      private boolean periodic
      This will indicate whether the timer is periodic (true) or a one shot timer. If periodic, it will keep timing and keep cycling when the time expires. If a one shot timer, it will fire once and then stop.

    • t

      private Thread t
      This variable holds the thread which is to tun for this timer.

    • keepThreadRunning

      private boolean keepThreadRunning

    • SPEEDUP

      private final int SPEEDUP

  • Method Details

    • startPeriodicTimer

      public void startPeriodicTimer(int delay)
      Description copied from interface: LightTimerInterface
      This method will start a periodic timer. The timer will cause the given expiration event to fire every time the timer reaches the delay time at which point it will reset and begin timing again.
      Specified by:
      startPeriodicTimer in interface LightTimerInterface
      Parameters:
      delay - This is the delay, in ms, for the given timer.

    • startOneShotTimer

      public void startOneShotTimer(int delay)
      Description copied from interface: LightTimerInterface
      This method will start a one shot timer. The timer will cause the given expiration event to fire after delay ms. It will then stop running.
      Specified by:
      startOneShotTimer in interface LightTimerInterface
      Parameters:
      delay - This is the delay in ms.

    • resetTimer

      public void resetTimer()
      Description copied from interface: LightTimerInterface
      This method will reset the timer, causing it to time from the starting delay value again but not firing the evenbt.
      Specified by:
      resetTimer in interface LightTimerInterface

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      Description copied from interface: LightTimerInterface
      This method will stop the given timen, killing off the running thread if applicable.
      Specified by:
      stopTimer in interface LightTimerInterface

    • setExpirationEvent

      public void setExpirationEvent(LightControllerCommandInterface.CommandActionEnum eventToFire)
      Description copied from interface: LightTimerInterface
      This method will set the event that is fired upon timer expiration.
      Specified by:
      setExpirationEvent in interface LightTimerInterface
      Parameters:
